solution_line_template: His reading speed is {pages_per_day_before}/{hours_per_day_before}=<<{pages_per_day_before}/{hours_per_day_before}={reading_speed_pages_per_hour}>>{reading_speed_pages_per_hour} pages a day
He reads {hours_per_day_before}*{increase_factor}=<<{hours_per_day_before}*{increase_factor}={increased_hours}>>{increased_hours} hours more now than before
So now he reads {hours_per_day_before}+{increased_hours}=<<{hours_per_day_before}+{increased_hours}={current_hours_per_day}>>{current_hours_per_day} hours per day
That means he reads {current_hours_per_day}*{reading_speed_pages_per_hour}=<<{current_hours_per_day}*{reading_speed_pages_per_hour}={current_pages_per_day}>>{current_pages_per_day} pages per day
So he reads {current_pages_per_day}*{days_per_week}=<<{current_pages_per_day}*{days_per_week}={pages_per_week}>>{pages_per_week} pages a week
